concept.title: Name Pages
concept.shortdesc: The rename web pages feature lets you create web page names in that are different from those names a visitor sees when accessing the web page. If you use a good naming convention for your web pages, renaming web pages is not typically necessary.

ul.li: If two pages are given the same name, they are not combined in reports. If you see two pages with the same name in reports, visit the Name Pages page to see whether this is the cause.
Classifications are based on the original name, even though the name given here will show up in classification exports.

row.entry: Names given here are based on the original page name, not the page URL. If the original page name changes, the new name appears in reports, even if the page URL remains the same.
Lets you restore the renamed page.
